arts.ttl: Mark Robins focuses on work to do as Stoke City fight for win at Sunderland
arts.sum: The new boss was happy with how good pressing from his forwards forced both goals at the Stadium of Light – leading to an early Tom Cannon penalty and a late Niall Ennis winner in extra-time – but he knows his young squad is very much a work in progress. They stuck at it and two goals came from our good play, good press, winning it back.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Sunderland as Niall Ennis finds magic moment
arts.sum: Stoke continued to look a threat through the half and Baker and Burger both had smart through balls just cut out by vital touches while Andrew Moran, playing from the right wing, decided against putting his foot through one pass from Burger to go for goal himself in preference of a more difficult pass to Baker. The stadium seemed to be expecting penalties when Ennis steamed into the Sunderland half with eight minutes to go, nicking the ball off Neil on the bounce, drawing and then rounding Moore after dummying a shot and then slotting home the winner from a narrow angle.

arts.ttl: Niall Ennis steps off the bench to sink Sunderland and put Stoke into round four
arts.sum: The Black Cats suffered a rare home defeat in the all-Championship FA Cup clash.

arts.ttl: Sunderland vs Stoke City live news, action and reaction from FA Cup third round
arts.sum: Sunderland have bounced back from an injury-time defeat at the bet365 Stadium to end 2024 by winning their first two games of the new year, both at home, against Sheffield United and Portsmouth. Click here to join in the debate through the afternoon.

arts.ttl: Every word from Mark Robins on the transfer window, injuries, Baker and Stoke City social
arts.sum: There is plenty on the agenda at this time of year, especially for a new manager getting up to speed with the club and getting to know the players he has available, with the January transfer window and the prospect of making additions in mind. You'll have to wait and see but rest assured I'll pick a team that's going to represent Stoke City in the best way possible.

arts.ttl: Stoke City transfer latest as Mark Robins insists big spending is not always the best answer
arts.sum: The tests at Stoke are of a completely different nature and can be found up and down the Championship: trying to find a way to compete against teams with Premier League cash while being constrained by the EFL’s financial fair play rules. Robins jumped into a huge challenge at his last club, going into Coventry City as they were about to be relegated to League Two amid protests about ownership and facing a couple of seasons playing without a proper home ground.

arts.ttl: Official: Roma send Le Fee to Sunderland
arts.sum: Roma have officially sent Enzo Le Fée to Sunderland on loan with an option to...

arts.ttl: Aleksic in: Sunderland team news and predicted XI to face Stoke City
arts.sum: The latest Sunderland team news as Regis Le Bris' side gear up to face Stoke City in the FA Cup. The post Aleksic in: Sunderland team news and predicted XI to face Stoke City appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: 'Quiet man' handed loud and clear mission as Stoke City troubles blamed on others
arts.sum: Stoke old boy Glen Johnson believes the Potters ’ well-documented issues extend beyond the players, but that the club should have enough to avoid relegation from the Championship this season. One man with Stoke connections knows new boss Mark Robins better than most - and he is convinced the Potters have finally got the right man as manager.

arts.ttl: “Sorry to let him go” – Claudio Ranieri gives his lengthy assessment of Le Fée to Sunderland
arts.sum: AS Roma manager Claudio Ranieri has admitted he is sorry to see midfielder Enzo Le Fée departing this month as he heads to Sunderland. Tuttomercatoweb cover comments from the Roma manager today in which he admits he wouldn’t have minded Le Fée remaining in the Italian capital.
